cab.content: From Viceroy, Foreign Department, Uh September 1919.. "(Received 9 pan.)Clear the line.1301. S. Secret. Afghanistan. Our telegram of the 31st August last, 1274 8.Letters have since been received from British Agent in Kabul. He complains of , rigorous confinement to Agency premises and insulting treatment up to 10th August,when he saw Amir and was set at liberty without any expression of regret, andpromised safe conduct to India about 1st September.We addressed Foreign Minister again on 2nd August [sic) expressing indignation , at flagrant disregard of international usage, and stated that, while evacuation ofDakka would proceed according to programme, Afghan postmaster and party wouldnot be repatriated, or caravans allowed through Khyber, till British Agent returns toIndia.
